7:00.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap

runners.name: Willem Twee
runners.comment: Has to bounce back and might not be able to do so over this 7f trip
runners.spotlight: Defied this mark the last time he contested a handicap, at Wolverhampton in 2024; soundly beaten all three runs since and was having just his third go over this longer trip when beating just Golden Mind latest; Heathcliff might be yard's best hope.

quotes.race: BetUK Golden Rose Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Willem Twee is a lovely horse. It was quite a tactical race, the pace was slow and I elected to stay three deep but to keep cover. I probably delivered him into the race early enough. He's a very nice horse, he's got a future. He gave me a lovely feel as I started to improve into the race round the turn - Oisin Murphy, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Mount Athos
runners.comment: Goes for hat-trick in this race and is 4-4 under James Doyle; a lot to like
runners.spotlight: Goes well fresh; 4-4 under James Doyle, including when justifying favouritism in this race in 2023 and 2024; as good as ever when landing Deauville Listed contest in November and possibly did a bit too much too soon in front under a new jockey there last time; shouldn't face much competition for the lead here; bold bid expected.

stable_tour.quote: I picked him as a horse to follow last year and he didn't let us down. He's taken a while to fill out his frame and mature mentally, but he's now doing everything as I hoped he would. He won his first race at Thirsk in June and on his comeback this year he completed a hat-trick at Kempton off a mark of 96. The handicapper has him up to 103 now but we'll be looking at stakes races, so that shouldn't matter too much. He could return to Thirsk next for a 7f conditions race, which would be ideal as we look to step forward. I'm not sure whether he wants an easy 7f on a bend or a stiff 6f. I remember Hey Gaman being very good over 7f and this fellow is rather similar in that respect. After that run we could go to Haydock for a 7f Listed race or to Longchamp for the Group 3 Prix du Palais-Royal, which Hey Gaman won. Racing will really help him improve and it's exciting looking forward with this colt. 19-04-23

runners.name: Roi De France
runners.comment: Highly progressive last year, bar a blip on soft ground in the Cambridgeshire
runners.spotlight: Bar a blip on soft ground in the Cambridgeshire, he made giant strides last year; did well to reel in Popmaster, who got first run on him, in November before finding a previous/subsequent Group 2 winner just too strong in Listed company the following month (both 1m here); fascinating contender tackling a trip this short for the first time.

runners.name: Golden Mind
runners.comment: Joint PB over 6f here last month but that was followed by him trailing in last
runners.spotlight: Had the run of the race out in front but showed a good attitude to hold off Heathcliff over 6f here last month (in first-time tongue-tie); never looked happy in Listed company 18 days ago and needs to bounce back.

quotes.race: Free Bet With Unibet's Betbuilder Rebound Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: There didn't seem to be much pace so when Golden Mind broke well I was able to get across and went fairly steady, getting the race my own way to be honest, and he's quickened up and done it well in the end. He gets 7f and I could see him going up in trip again - Oisin Orr, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Popmaster
runners.comment: Gave Roi De France a couple of very good races here last winter; quiet the last twice
runners.spotlight: No win since September 2023 but he gave Roi De France a couple of very good races here last winter; would like to have seen more the last twice.

quotes.race: Howden Challenge Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Tom Marquand just thought Popmaster had a little look at the other horse and it's so unfair [to be beaten in a photo]. He's running out of his skin at the moment and he's a great servant. If he doesn't run on Champions Day I think we'll put him away for the season but I'll have to speak to Ed Walker - Laurence Bellman, owner.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I've been second in so many big handicaps, an Ayr Gold Cup with Great Ambassador and we were second in the Kensington Palace here this week, and second in a Stewards' Cup. It's so frustrating, but they're so hard to win. Popmaster was spot on for today and I remember saying to Laurence (Bellman, owner) at Chelmsford when we were beaten and so disappointed that might have just won us a Wokingham - because it got his confidence back and we didn't have a penalty. It looked like we had a good draw and Tom gave him a peach of a ride, but we've Ryan Moore to blame! We'll go for all the big sprint handicaps and we hope he's got one in him - Ed Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: Fever-Tree Handicap
quotes.quote: We think Popmaster will be better next year and he's a good fun sprinter, who has been a bit unlucky this year - Laurence Bellman, owner.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming high with him this season and I think he ran well in the Hungerford. We won't see him at his best until it's soft and with some cut in the ground at Doncaster, I wouldn't be surprised to see him run a huge race in the Park Stakes. 11-09-24

He ran okay in the Abernant considering he's not a huge fan of Newmarket. He's high in the handicap so we'll keep him to stakes company. He's a Listed winner who was only beaten three lengths in a hot Group 3. 25-04-24

runners.name: Nikovo

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: This is tougher and he'll do well to make his first visit here a winning one
runners.spotlight: 2-5 for Michael Herrington; coped with dropping back to 7f for the first time at Newcastle 22 days ago, beating good yardstick by a neck; up 3lb and this is tougher so he'll do well to make his first visit here a winning one.

runners.name: Heathcliff
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P Hopper, Mr & Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: 3-3 over this far, all at this venue; good late work over 6f the last twice
runners.spotlight: 3-3 over this far, all at this venue; the way he stayed on over 6f at Newcastle and here (behind Golden Mind) the last twice suggests he's not handicapped out of things; the pick.

runners.name: Local Hero
runners.comment: Capable of bouncing back but 1m rather than 7f might be his preferred trip
runners.spotlight: Wasn't seen to best effect in hot AW handicap last time, having not really got the breaks the time before; earlier win at this track suggests 1m rather than 7f might be his preferred trip.

runners.name: Kings Lynn

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen
HM The King & HM The Queen

runners.comment: On a losing run of 27 and seemingly had no excuses the last twice
runners.spotlight: On a losing run of 27 and seemingly had no excuses the last twice, most recently when behind Golden Mind and Heathcliff; having just his second start over this far with Hayley Turner up for the first time.

quotes.race: Cazoo Temple Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: It would be a dream come true if King's Lynn were able to win at Royal Ascot and he's a horse with plenty of ability. He's got a lot of speed and is able to pick up, so a stiff five furlongs at Royal Ascot would be ideal for him - David Probert, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Achilles Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: King's Lynn is just learning how to sprint now. The ground was a little tacky for him and I felt the best ground was over on the inside. It's fresh and hasn't had much racing on so I was keen to get over there. He stuck his head out and it was a good performance. He had a good run at Chester and got a little lost but today was a huge step up in form and I'm delighted with him - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Racing Bank Â£300,000 2-Y-O Stakes
quotes.quote: King's Lynn has got a wonderful temperament. He was in the stalls first and he popped out and got plenty of cover. He travelled well and picked up. He's obviously going the right way, he's still quite raw and I think he'll make a lovely three-year-old. It's hard to judge what figure he's run to but he's run to a fair level. He obviously has a big heart - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: This is a high-class sprinter and we've taken the decision to try to make him into a 5f horse. I think sprinting takes practice and he should get better with experience over the minimum trip. The King's Stand Stakes is a possibility, but he will have to win his next start in order to go there. As a back up we will give him an entry in the Wokingham. 19-05-21

7:30.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boost's Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Best Rate
runners.comment: Had a few subsequent winners behind when winning 7f Wolverhampton novice on third start
runners.spotlight: Had a few subsequent winners behind when winning 7f Wolverhampton novice on third start last year; opening mark seems fair enough and this trip ought to be fine for him, although he's drawn widest; newly gelded.

runners.name: Brindavan
runners.comment: Won C&D nursery last year and runner-up in another such race at Southwell in October
runners.spotlight: Won C&D nursery last year and runner-up in another such race at Southwell when last seen in October; may have more to give; newly gelded.

runners.name: Kameel
runners.comment: Has won a maiden and a novice from two starts over 7f at Newcastle under Kaiya Fraser
runners.spotlight: Has won a maiden and a novice from two starts over 7f at Newcastle under Kaiya Fraser; this trip should be fine for him and his opening mark seems workable; obvious contender.

runners.name: Spirit Lead Me
runners.comment: Fair nursery form last year including a C&D win; needs to progress some more
runners.spotlight: Fair nursery form last year including a C&D win; needs to progress some more to deal with some less-exposed rivals; newly gelded.

runners.name: Sweet Fantastic
runners.comment: In fair form over 7f including Class 5 handicap win here under Hollie Doyle two starts ago
runners.spotlight: In fair form over 7f including Class 5 handicap win here under Hollie Doyle two starts ago; ready for this trip now; chance.

runners.name: Invited
runners.comment: Didn't appear to match his best when winning 1m Southwell maiden in January; more needed
runners.spotlight: Didn't appear to match his best form when winning 1m Southwell maiden in January; more needed now two months on.

quotes.race: Bet MGM: It's Showtime Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a nice spot for Invited today, and the race couldn't have gone any smoother for him - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Berkshire Smudge
runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.comment: Showed ability without looking the finished article in four starts last year
runners.spotlight: Showed ability without looking the finished article in four starts last year; absent since August, but could do better now, with the champion jockey booked; newly gelded.

4:20.race_name: Unibet Zero% Mission/EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Greydreambeliever
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxv & E Burke
runners.comment: Debut 6f winner; respectable Group 3 run latest; concedes weight but sets the standard.
runners.spotlight: 14-1 and showed plenty of promise when winning on debut at York (6f, good to firm) last July; still looked green when putting in a respectable effort in a Salisbury Group 3 event (6f, good to soft) last September; has to concede weight all around but sets the standard.

runners.name: Boubou
runners.comment: Made a promising debut but couldn't build on that latest; more needed.
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise on debut at Newbury last October (6.5f, heavy); unable to improve on that when switched to Tapeta at Southwell (6f) 18 days later; has since left Richard Hannon, changing hands for 6,500gns in January; more needed.

runners.name: Ellbryn
runners.comment: 200-1 on debut (6f, AW), when she ran green and was beaten almost 7l; much more needed.
runners.spotlight: 200-1 on debut at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack), when she ran green and was beaten almost 7l; much more needed.

runners.name: Glamour Show
runners.comment: Placed five times in succession; can go well but needs to raise the bar to break her duck.
runners.spotlight: Free-going filly who has been placed on five successive occasions since her debut, including over C&D latest; should take the measure of most of this field but needs to raise the bar to break her duck.

runners.name: Lady Shinto
runners.comment: Posted two moderate efforts at Chelmsford and Brighton last June; watching brief advised.
runners.spotlight: Posted moderate efforts at both Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) and Brighton (6f, good to firm) last June; watching brief advised.

runners.name: Volcanic Dancer
runners.comment: Raced freely when beaten favourite at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) in January; more needed.
runners.spotlight: 150-1 and looked green on debut here (7f) last December; raced freely when beaten favourite at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) in January, her only other start; more needed.

8:30.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap (London Stayers' Qualifier)

runners.name: Golden Flame

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: 2nd at Newcastle (2m) last month before tailing off at 100-1 in a Class 2 at Lingfield
runners.spotlight: Useful in his prime but all of his three wins were in 2021; has seen more action again lately, finishing second at Newcastle (2m, Tapeta) on penultimate start, before tailing off at 100-1 in Class 2 event at Lingfield; chance judged on that penultimate start but probably not the percentage call.

quotes.race: "My Odds Boost" On Betfair Handicap
quotes.quote: It's pretty fast out there. The first two winners made all, it's suiting the front runners and Joe Fanning is the master of it - though, to be fair to Golden Flame, he looked as though he was the last off the bridle there - Jock Bennett, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Legacy Power
runners.comment: Made all over C&D last February; absent since a heavy defeat at Goodwood last May
runners.spotlight: Off the mark (made all) over C&D last February and good second at Chelmsford next time, but not seen since a heavy defeat at Goodwood last May; wore cheekpieces on last two starts; player if resuming in top form.

runners.name: Grey Fox
runners.comment: Nearly overcame trouble when upped to 2m here; interesting if ready after his break since
runners.spotlight: Last five wins were over 1m (the latest last May) but he showed promise over 1m4f here on penultimate start and the leap up to 2m nearly paid dividends when he was beaten a neck over C&D later in October after trouble in running; back up just 1lb, he has to be of interest if ready after his break.

runners.name: Naasma
runners.comment: C&D win in October; Lingfield 1m2f run last month suggests she'll be primed for a big run
runners.spotlight: Won on turf (11.4f) and Kempton Polytrack (2m in October) last year; creditable reappearance over just 1m2f at Lingfield last month suggests she will be primed for a big run today.

runners.name: Donald Llewellyn
runners.comment: C&D winner; back to Flat racing with a bang under Ashley Lewis at Lingfield (1m4f) latest
runners.spotlight: Three wins at Kempton in 2023, the last two of which were over 2m; lightly raced since but returned to Flat racing with a bang under Ashley Lewis at Lingfield (1m4f) three weeks ago, going on 3f out after a very awkward start; 4lb rise makes this a career-high mark but he needs respect.

runners.name: Doublethetrouble

prev_owners.owner: R W Hayward & Mrs B Wakelin
R W Hayward & E R Wakelin

runners.comment: Beaten a nose over C&D last September in hat-trick bid; continues to run with credit
runners.spotlight: Two wins from 38 starts but both were at 2m on AW last September and he was beaten a nose over C&D next time; continues to run with credit and should be seriously involved.

6:00.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Mcintosh
runners.comment: Two good 6f efforts so far; the extra furlong should suit in his first handicap
runners.spotlight: Chased home a hot favourite, who'd had a run, on debut at Chelmsford and duly did the business at Wolverhampton next time; promises to be suited by this extra furlong and has been found a good spot for his first handicap.

runners.name: Lady Manzor
runners.comment: Winner of a novice and C&D handicap; no surprise if landing the hat-trick up just 4lb
runners.spotlight: Three runs at 7f; a different proposition this year, winning a Lingfield novice and a C&D handicap under Jack Dace; she won decisively despite a sluggish start last time so a 4lb higher mark not insurmountable.

runners.name: Noble Guest
runners.breeder: Boyce Bloodstock & Mrs C E Percival
runners.comment: Just one run of note as 2yo but highly likely he has more to offer this year
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to seven winners, three achieving triple-figure RPRs; just one run of note as 2yo, when making the frame in 7f Yarmouth maiden; market can guide on return.

runners.name: Notimeforchitchat
runners.comment: Ended juvenile campaign on a low note; perhaps best watched for all he's drawn to attack
runners.spotlight: Four runs as 2yo; made all in 1m novice here second time out but not sure that contest took much winning in the end; couldn't build on it on soft ground next time and subsequently finished down the field over C&D; gelded since; perhaps best watched for all he's drawn to attack.

stable_tour.quote: He won really well over a mile at Kempton last time on his second run. He's a big horse, probably 16.1hh, and shouldn't have been able to win as a two-year-old. He's a big, weak horse, but he was very impressive when he won. He's exciting going forward. 18-09-24

runners.name: Final Night
runners.comment: Could take good step forward now handicapping; watch the market
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye in both starts here and would have finished closer at Chelmsford last time but for being held up at a crucial stage by a hanging rival; consider, particularly if market vibes are positive on handicap debut.

runners.name: Standput
runners.comment: Winning handicap debut in January but vulnerable on subsequent fourth at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Struck on handicap debut at Wolverhampton in January; beaten just over a length into fourth at Southwell six weeks ago (also 7f); again vulnerable in what looks a fair race.

runners.name: Packetofbiscuits
runners.comment: Runner-up in a much slower division than the one Lady Manzor won over C&D three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: 0-7; runner-up in a much slower division than the one Lady Manzor won over C&D three weeks ago; could have done without 2lb rise.

runners.name: Penelope Valentine
runners.comment: More to do than when readily beating just five rivals over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: It wasn't much of a race she broke through in over C&D five weeks ago, with three of the nine runners withdrawn at the start; she did it very well, though, and an 8lb rise is probably justified.

runners.name: Bermuda Princess
runners.comment: Obvious scope for improvement in handicaps at 7f for new yard
runners.spotlight: Improver, from low base, for William Haggas last summer and has obvious scope to improve now handicapping and upped to 7f for Ed Walker; Oisin Murphy has 27% strike-rate for the yard in the last five years.

runners.name: Psychodrama
runners.comment: Main concern is how she'll settle going beyond 6f for the first time
runners.spotlight: Doesn't look the easiest but main concern is how she'll settle going beyond 6f for the first time.

4:55.race_name: Racing TV Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.name: Shameful
runners.comment: Could be up to defying a 7lb penalty with this extra furlong likely to suit
runners.spotlight: 2,000 Guineas and Irish 2,000 Guineas entry; well found in the market and won cosily on debut at Newbury in September; that form is only ordinary for the track but he could be up to defying a 7lb penalty with this extra furlong likely to suit.

runners.name: An Fear Beag
runners.comment: Trainer less than 5% in maiden/novice contests last five years
runners.spotlight: 4,000euros foal; first foal; dam 5f 2yo winner (RPR 68); probably best watched from widest stall with trainer less than 5% in maiden/novice contests last five years; already gelded.

runners.name: Benny The Bouncer
runners.comment: Big backward step when tailed off at Lingfield three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Ran okay on debut over C&D in February but tailed off, and finished three places behind Shabu Shabu, at Lingfield three weeks ago (1m).

runners.name: Blackbrook
runners.comment: Trainer knows the family well; this one showed next to nothing at two
runners.spotlight: Trainer knows the family well; this one showed next to nothing at two; hood comes off.

runners.name: Man Of La Mancha
runners.comment: Similar form in his two novice runs; probably needs more to win
runners.spotlight: Pleasing fifth on debut here in December; disappointing 2-1 shot at Southwell 25 days ago but achieved a similar amount in RPR terms; probably needs more to win; drops back from 1m.

runners.name: Marvelman
runners.comment: Ran to RPR of 83 on heavy ground the last twice; worth sticking with
runners.spotlight: Ran to RPR of 83 on heavy ground the last twice; will find this surface altogether different but he's worth sticking with.

runners.name: Rupert The Prince
runners.comment: Tailed off in maiden contests here and at Lingfield this year; can only watch
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in maiden contests here and at Lingfield this year; can only watch.

runners.name: Shabu Shabu
runners.comment: Probably wants to go up again in trip rather than returning to 7f
runners.spotlight: Small step forward three weeks ago but probably wants to go up again in trip rather than returning to 7f.

runners.name: Zappata
runners.comment: Handicaps after this should present him with an opportunity to win
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in 6f maiden and 7f novice at Wolverhampton this month; handicaps after this should present him with an opportunity to win; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Zero Zero
runners.comment: Trainer 16% in maidens/novices last five years; monitor betting
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to US 5.5f-6.5f winner Philipsburg (including AW); dam unraced; trainer 16% in maidens/novices last five years; monitor betting; already gelded.

runners.name: Brightlikeadiamond
runners.comment: Trainer 0-10 in maidens/novices last five years; others more obvious
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; dam 5.7f-7f winner (including AW; RPR 97); trainer 0-10 in maidens/novices last five years; others more obvious.

runners.name: Westington House
runners.owner: C Engel, S Nettleton & J Palmer-Brown
runners.comment: Looks the pick of the newcomers; rail draw; watch market
runners.spotlight: $27,000 yearling; resold as a yearling for $80,000; sixth foal; half-sister to US winners Big Cyn (6f/1m dirt) and Otis On The Cape (5f turf/6f dirt); dam US stakes-placed 5.5f-6.5f dirt winner; looks the pick of the newcomers; rail draw; watch market.

8:00.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap

runners.name: Port Erin
runners.comment: All 4 wins at about 1m; form has dropped off of late; now tries 6f for first time
runners.spotlight: All four AW wins at about 1m and this is his first 6f run; form has dropped off since Chelmsford win in December, tried in cheekpieces two starts ago before crying enough some way out here this month; queried.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I spoke to Jack Mitchell who has done a lot of work on Port Erin and he said 'he's just a galloper' so I was quite happy to go and do my own thing. He got into a nice rhythm on the front end and when I didn't get hassle for the first couple of furlongs, I knew he was going to take a lot of beating then - P J McDonald, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Collusion
runners.comment: Two 6f Wolverhampton wins in 2025; needs to prove as effective on Polytrack but improving
runners.spotlight: Has looked ahead of the handicapper on last two 6f starts at Wolverhampton, overcoming slow starts each time; needs to prove as effective on Polytrack, having never got into the action in amateur jockeys' race over C&D previously, but the chance looks worth taking.

runners.name: First Company
runners.comment: Three C&D wins, all for Billy Loughnane who rides for the first time since November win
runners.spotlight: Has made the running for two of three C&D wins, most recently in November; has found things harder since but Billy Loughnane, who's ridden him for each of those wins, is back in the saddle for the first time since; prominent show expected.

runners.name: Kodi Red
runners.comment: Blows in and out of form but 3lb lower than winning mark in October; first course run
runners.spotlight: Tends to blow in and out of form but he's 3lb lower than his 6f win at Chelmsford in October and he didn't do badly there 13 days ago; not dismissed on first course run.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Instagram Race
quotes.quote: He is an improving horse and has improved from every run. Seamie said he never had a moment's worry and was a winner all the way. Kodi Red is a lovely horse, we're not sure where we go next but he is for sale - Adrian Murray, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Kodi Red showed us plenty early on but he was just very green in his races, but every time he ran he showed more and today was the first time he looked really professional. He has always looked like a nice horse - Adrian Murray, trainer

runners.name: Four Adaay
runners.comment: C&D winner who is 2-6 for Oisin Murphy and can be involved now down in grade
runners.spotlight: Losing AW run goes back to C&D win nearly two years ago but she's not badly treated now and ran well for a long way in a better race here last time; has a 2-6 record for Oisin Murphy and can be involved.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a bit out of sorts but has become very well-handicapped. She was a very unlucky loser last month at Nottingham where she got in a bit of trouble, so she should pick up a few races between now and the end of the season. 11-07-24

runners.name: Arlecchinos Gift
runners.comment: Multiple wins, the latest over C&D in February; close with Collusion on Wolverhampton form
runners.spotlight: Has done connections proud down the years, winning five times since last March and making all from the widest draw (as today, though in a smaller field) over C&D last month; little between him and Collusion on a recent Wolverhampton run and can be thereabouts again.

quotes.race: Read Kevin Blake On attheraces.com Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance from Arlecchino's Gift. They went off quick enough which helped at the end and that was nice as most of his best form until now was on the all-weather. That drop of rain we had last night helped - Dane O'Neill, rider.

runners.name: Ten Club
runners.comment: C&D winner for previous yard; signs of recapturing form for new trainer latest
runners.spotlight: Two 6f AW wins in 2024 included one here; went off the boil in the autumn but he shaped quite nicely on second run for new yard at Wolverhampton (5f) 15 days ago and another improved show is on the cards.

runners.name: Harry Brown
runners.owner: Peter Crate And Gallagher Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Smart sprint form up to the middle of 2024; back in form but draw doesn't favour him
runners.spotlight: Had some smart sprint form up to the middle of 2024; not at the same level now but he's found his level and finished close up back over 6f at Lingfield this month; the draw doesn't favour him here, however.

quotes.race: It's Time To Turn To talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: Harry Brown is a 5f horse really but gets 6f around here. He did that well as he had a lot of weight and will be an interesting horse on the grass - Hayley Turner, jockey.

runners.name: Rusheen Boy
runners.comment: Made most for 6f Southwell wins in 2023; likely to have competition for lead; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Made most for two 6f wins at Southwell in late 2023 but he took a hit in the weights and it's been only a slow descent since; has a wide draw today and competition likely for the lead.

runners.name: Sonmarg

prev_owners.owner: J William Rowley & S P C Woods

runners.comment: Maiden on AW; down weights since making yard debut and of interest with Rossa Ryan up
runners.spotlight: Turf winner at 6f; maiden on AW and below best in two AW handicaps at this trip but he's dropped a few pounds since making his yard debut and remains of interest on autumn form with Rossa Ryan up for the first time.

runners.name: El Hibri
runners.comment: C&D winner; favourably treated; something to find on balance of form since win last May
runners.spotlight: Can lead; one C&D win from five attempts but he had every chance when just keeping on at the same pace here last month and has something to find on balance of form since latest win last May.

6:30.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Solar Army
runners.comment: Obvious claims if ready to roll back from a short break

quotes.quote: Berliet Express has been great but he has a wind issue. I thought Jack was getting there way too early but he kept him on the bridle and kept him travelling. Running down the hill to home here at Gowran suited him and I thought it would work as long as they went quick enough in front of him early on. The race fell apart and it worked out great.
