runners.spotlight: Won in the winter last term on his first two starts over fences; runner-up under Freddie Mitchell in three of his five races this term (2m-2m4f) and surely has a big shout in this small field.

quotes.race: New 'Bet-In-Race' With Coral Handicap Chase (For The Hallowe'En Trophy)
quotes.quote: Niall was very good on Issar d'Airy and let him find his feet and get into the race quietly. We'll go gently-gently and he's quite a light horse, one not easy to keep condition on, so you wouldn't want him out tomorrow morning. We'll take our time and see what the handicapper has to say - Gary Moore, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We'll probably step him up in trip this season and ideally keep him to the flatter tracks. He won twice at Newbury last season and that would be the ideal track for him. The Sir Peter O'Sullevan Chase at the Coral Gold Cup meeting might be a good fit. He was still weak last season, so did well to achieve what he did, and he's strengthened up again over the summer. 29-10-24

runners.name: Ryans Rocket
runners.comment: Failed to get home, albeit on soft, in 2m5f novice handicap at Cheltenham two months ago
runners.spotlight: Second season under rules; three hurdle/chase wins at 2m; 3m point winner but failed to get home, albeit on soft going, in 2m5f novice handicap at Cheltenham two months ago when last seen; this race is a furlong and a bit shorter, much less demanding company and he could still have potential.

quotes.race: Kempton Park Working With The Community Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ryan's Rocket is a nice horse and he's done that well. He's been kept going through the depths of winter waiting for the better ground and has done well physically, but he'll benefit for a break - Jonathan Burke, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Ran in a couple of bumpers and then won his two hurdle starts before his summer break. He came back in the Persian War and was beaten in the first mile after racing completely with the choke out. To his credit, he did well to finish fourth. We're going to go chasing now and will probably drop back in trip. He'll do well when the ground is good in the spring, so he won't be running in the depths of winter. He's a big chasing type. 24-10-24

runners.name: Stormin Crossgales
runners.comment: Two front-running wins this winter but pulled up both starts since
runners.spotlight: Made pretty much all to win back-to-back handicaps at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) and Southwell (2m4f, soft) this winter, the latter in a small field but by 35l (3lb higher today); pulled up, however, on both starts since and that has to be a worry despite this small field.

quotes.race: Jordan Road Planning Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was brilliant - if Noel Fehily doesn't send us a horse now, he never will! We got Stormin Crossgales for 5,000GBP from Doncaster Sales, and it's taken a bit of time to get to know him. I kept the headgear on for a while as that's what he had on before, but taking it off has really worked. His jumping is key, and that's what wins races for him. To jump and stay 2m4f on that ground is unbelievable - Adam Pogson, joint trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Stormin Crossgales just needed a bit of confidence. He had a hood and a tongue strap and we've taken the whole lot off. You've got to ride him positively and he's a strong stayer over two miles. It takes some winning round here, making the running like that - Adam Pogson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The whole race was working out perfectly, I was settled and Stormin Crossgales was jumping great but the saddle just went completely sideways and I couldn't get my right leg out. I thought for a second I was coming off him. Somehow I slipped my right foot out and we were still in front, which was the main thing. He stayed straight thankfully, if he jinked or anything I was a goner - Jack Hogan, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

quotes.race: Colin Lewis Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stormin Crossgales is not an easy ride and wouldn't settle in his bumpers. He's a lovely horse who is only a frame of a horse - you won't see the best of him until next year. We thought we'd be hurdling now and chasing this time next year, but we kicked on and he's an out-and-out chaser. He'll get bigger and stronger as he gets older. He's a big baby who likes nice ground, but he will cope with slower ground when he gets older - Dave Crosse, owners' representative.

runners.name: Ostend
runners.owner: Jamie Rock, A Lewis, M Howell & Partner
runners.comment: Sole hurdles win in Ireland (April 2023) stands out; now 11lb lower than on British debut
runners.spotlight: Improved to win a 2m3f maiden hurdle in Ireland in April 2023; not so good since, including his five starts for this yard and the last four were over fences; now 11lb lower than on British debut and tongue tied first time.

stable_tour.quote: We've had a stop-start campaign with him. He ran in a big handicap at Ascot on his sole start last season. He had a bit of an education over fences at Bangor first time back but then fell early on at Southwell on Monday. He's a big chasing type. 19-02-25

4:25.race_name: Experience Irish Racing With ITM Handicap Chase
4:25.going_detailed: GOOD (GoingStick: Chase 8.0, Hurdle 7.9) (Selective watering to maintain)

runners.name: Bold Jury
runners.comment: 11-1 for chase/handicap debut over C&D (good) ten days ago but unseated at the second
runners.spotlight: Ran out over hurdles three starts back; 11-1 for chase/handicap debut over C&D (good) ten days ago but got the second fence wrong and unseated; early days but no solid claims at present.

runners.name: Mcgrath From Clune
runners.comment: Out of form on final three Irish runs and the same story on his three starts in Britain
runners.spotlight: Good chance on best Irish efforts over hurdles/fences; out of form on final three runs there and it's been the same story on his three starts in Britain; latest was at least a step back in the right direction.

runners.name: We Got Your Back
runners.comment: Won at Leicester and Catterick this winter; good second at Southwell (2m1f) latest outing
runners.spotlight: Won at Leicester and Catterick this winter; soundly beaten over 2m4f next time but good second at Southwell (2m1f) on latest outing, confirming he should be a leading player today.

runners.name: Ensel Du Perche
runners.comment: 11yo with up-and-down profile; tailed off penultimate outing but Catterick win either side
runners.spotlight: 11yo who has an up-and-down profile, which was well illustrated when he tailed off on penultimate outing but won at Catterick on starts either side; those two wins came front-running in small fields; has to considered seriously despite the inconsistency.

runners.name: Conquer The Breeze
runners.comment: Best hurdles form reads very well but form-figures of FPPP switched to handicap chases
runners.spotlight: Second in novice hurdle at Hexham (2m, good to soft) last May, which reads very well compared to today's mark, but he has form-figures of FPPP since switched to handicap chases.

runners.name: Pittsburg
runners.comment: 3-17 chasing, last win Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last July; C&D 3rd of six (good) ten days ago
runners.spotlight: 3-17 chasing, the latest win at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last July; 6lb lower today, having failed to fire in most subsequent starts; latest wasn't too bad when third of six over C&D (good) ten days ago but better is needed.

runners.name: Fast Deal
runners.comment: 57 races overall for one win, for 7lb claimer at Stratford last April over 3m4f
runners.spotlight: 57 races overall for one win, for 7lb claimer at Stratford last April over 3m4f; second over 2m5f/2m6f last May/June but he's not done much since, including over 2m on latest start; 3lb out of the handicap.

2:45.race_name: Visit Irish Bloodstock Sales With ITM Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
2:45.going_detailed: GOOD (GoingStick: Chase 8.0, Hurdle 7.9) (Selective watering to maintain)

runners.name: Bodygroove
runners.comment: Won last week's handicap hurdle debut at Wetherby (2m) off this mark under Joshua Thompson
runners.spotlight: Fair 1m6f Flat winner; went close on hurdle debut last February and last week's handicap hurdle debut at Wetherby (2m, good) saw him back on song for the first time, winning a seven-runner race at 25-1 under Joshua Thompson; sole attempt at 2m4f was penultimate start, which came after 268 days off so perhaps is best forgiven; key player off same mark as eight days ago.

runners.name: Youdecide
runners.comment: Won handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m5f) in clearcut style from I'm Your Buckaroo; up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming under rules until handicap debut at Huntingdon (upped from 2m to 2m5f, good) two weeks ago in which he started favourite in seven-runner race and won in clearcut style under 5lb claimer from I'm Your Buckaroo; raised 5lb but could have more to offer.

quotes.race: Join The 20 Club At Huntingdon Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Youdecide has enjoyed the step up in trip here and will make a nice horse next year when he strengthens up - Tom David, trainer's assistant.

runners.name: George Darling
runners.comment: No solid form claims but it's his handicap debut and the move up from 2m should suit
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite in two points; beaten at least 33l when mid-division in three maiden hurdles, so he brings no solid form claims but it's his handicap debut and the move up from 2m should suit.

runners.name: Je Viens Du Large
runners.owner: Ben Turner Racing And Laplaces Daemon
runners.comment: Went from about 2m4f to 2m for both handicaps but pretty disappointing; tongue tied now
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; dropped from about 2m4f to 2m for his two handicaps but was pretty disappointing, favourite when tried in cheekpieces last time; now has his tongue tied as well and moves back up in trip.

runners.name: Scottish King
runners.comment: Handicapping last three runs and easily best of those was the first (2m4f); now 9lb lower
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 9yo who went handicapping for last three starts but easily best of those was the first (Uttoxeter 2m4f); 9lb lower than on that handicap debut, which means a case can be made.

runners.name: Im Your Buckaroo
runners.comment: Made much harder work of it than Youdecide when 2nd at Huntingdon (2m5f); cheekpieces now
runners.spotlight: Moved back up in trip and away from soft/heavy ground when second of seven on handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m5f, good); he made much harder work of it than winner Youdecide and now has cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Macs Xpress
runners.comment: 0-25 trained in Ireland; player on lots of that form but four heavy defeats for new yard
runners.spotlight: 0-25 when trained in Ireland; player on lots of that form but he's had four heavy defeats for new yard; tongue-tie is removed.

runners.name: Dreamings Free
runners.comment: Heavy defeats on all three starts for new yard, admittedly at huge odds in maidens
runners.spotlight: Low-level maiden in Ireland, including in handicap hurdles and points; heavy defeats on all three starts for new yard, admittedly at huge odds in maidens and he now moves back into a handicap.

runners.name: Rhiannon Ring
runners.comment: Third at Catterick (2m) and Southwell (2m1f) in the last two of her three handicaps
runners.spotlight: Third on good to soft at Catterick (2m) and Southwell (2m1f) in the last two of her three handicaps; not so good over this sort of trip on previous two outings but worth a second look.

2:15.race_name: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:15.going_detailed: GOOD (GoingStick: Chase 8.0, Hurdle 7.9) (Selective watering to maintain)

runners.name: Castanea Breeze
runners.comment: Third at Wetherby (soft) and Huntingdon (good to soft) in his last two bumpers; considered
runners.spotlight: Third at Wetherby (soft) and Huntingdon (good to soft) in his last two bumpers and pedigree also gives encouragement; the existing hurdles form in this line-up isn't great, so he could be big player on hurdle debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's very much a work in progress. He's been immature mentally but he's improving with every run, finishing sixth on his first start in a bumper, then third on the last two occasions. Hopefully we'll give him a run over hurdles towards the end of the month, possibly at somewhere like Market Rasen over 2m4f. His schooling's been good and I think he's going to be a nice horse. 19-03-25

runners.name: Hes A Diamond
runners.comment: Improved show in his latest bumper but that 20l fourth of six was modest form nonetheless
runners.spotlight: Second in Irish point; followed wind surgery with an improved show at Newcastle (good; 66-1) in his third bumper but that 20l fourth of six was modest form nonetheless; makes hurdle debut.

runners.name: Loch Frisa
runners.comment: Some ability at Ludlow in his second maiden hurdle; this drop back in trip might help
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in his only bumper and at Ludlow (3m, good to soft; 20-1) in his second maiden hurdle; this drop back in trip might help and he's a likely player.

runners.name: New Invention
runners.comment: Readily left behind by first three at Newcastle (2m1f) but any progress gives good chance
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful pedigree; 15-2 for maiden hurdle at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft) on debut one month ago, readily left behind by the first three but he stuck to his task pretty well; any improvement on that should give him a good chance in what looks a weak field.

runners.name: Raincloud
runners.comment: Bits of modest form but overall tally is now 0-24 (0-9 hurdles); tongue tied first time
runners.spotlight: Bits of modest form include two runs at this track (2m1f/2m5f) last autumn but two handicaps at turn of the year did not go well and her overall tally is now 0-24 (0-9 over hurdles); tongue tied first time.

runners.name: Charlie Baloo
runners.comment: 28-1, never-dangerous ninth of 12 in bumper at Doncaster (good) early this month
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam a fairly useful 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner for connections; 28-1, never-dangerous ninth of 12 in bumper at Doncaster (good) early this month.

3:50.race_name: Eileen Brough Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle
3:50.going_detailed: GOOD (GoingStick: Chase 8.0, Hurdle 7.9) (Selective watering to maintain)

runners.name: Mistress Emma
runners.comment: Off 903 days before this term; 3rd in novice at Warwick (2m3f) and looks better than that
runners.spotlight: Returned with a leg injury after winning Worcester bumper (good) in June 2022; off 903 days before two runs over hurdles this winter, better effort when third of ten at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) last time and she travelled well before making a hash of the final flight; looks better than that and should have good prospects on this handicap debut.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mistress Emma is a bit better than your ordinary summer bumper horse. She didn't show any signs of greenness and was very straightforward. I think she's got a really nice career ahead of her - Nico de Boinville, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She came here a couple of years ago and won a bumper in the summer, but she returned with a leg injury and has been off for more than two years. She looks much bigger and stronger now and we can really look forward to going straight over hurdles. 22-10-24

runners.name: Saisissante

prev_owners.owner: Agv Karwin Stud, Chauvigny Global Equine Sasu Et Al

runners.comment: Good 3rd at Hereford (2m) in November after a year off; right out of form both runs since
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins early in 2023 and another at Ludlow that November on second start over hurdles; good third at Hereford (2m) in November this term when making handicap hurdle debut after a year off, but right out of form on her two starts since.

runners.name: Feet On The Ground
runners.comment: Cut out in the closing stages of handicap debut at Warwick (extended 1m7f, good to soft)
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden, best effort when third in novice at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) on penultimate start; she cut out in the closing stages of handicap debut at Warwick (extended 1m7f, good to soft) three weeks ago, however, and needs to better that form by some way.

runners.name: D Day Arvalenreeva
runners.comment: Fair on Flat; third at Wincanton (1m7f) in second hurdle race but needs to progress again
runners.spotlight: Fair form (won once) over 1m3f-1m4f on Flat; made hurdle debut at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) in January, finishing 11l behind Feet On The Ground; better when third of 12 at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) three weeks ago but she needs to progress from that as well; handicap hurdle debut.

runners.name: Nobodys Perfect
runners.comment: Held up and led run-in for 4l win in ten-runner race at Exeter (2m2f, good) 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: Held up and led run-in for 4l win in ten-runner race at Exeter (2m2f, good) 19 days ago in her second handicap; 6lb higher today but there was plenty to like about that performance.

5:00.race_name: Think Thoroughbred - Think Ireland Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
5:00.going_detailed: GOOD (GoingStick: Chase 8.0, Hurdle 7.9) (Selective watering to maintain)

runners.name: Exiguus
runners.comment: 28-1, remote fourth of seven over C&D (good to soft) five weeks ago
runners.spotlight: 28-1, remote fourth of seven over C&D (good to soft) five weeks ago.

runners.name: Greedy Smith
runners.comment: 46,000euros foal, 65,000euros 3yo; major yard and needs a market check
runners.spotlight: 46,000euros foal, 65,000euros 3yo; third foal; dam unplaced bumpers/2m-2m4f hurdle races, half-sister to French 3m Grade 1 hurdle winner Galop Marin, out of 2m1f/2m5f chase winner; major yard and needs a market check.

stable_tour.quote: A nice type who will probably run in a couple of bumpers this season. He's still a bit of a frame, so we won't rush him, but he's showing us some nice things at home. 06-11-24

runners.name: Plains Drifter
runners.comment: Third of five in an Irish maiden point in November and made Â£20,000 the following month
runners.spotlight: 12,000euros 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to point winner Ask Mike; dam well beaten half-sister to bumper/2m2f hurdle winner Maggie Connolly, out of unraced half-sister to smart bumper/2m hurdle winner Hidebound; third of five in Irish maiden point in November and made Â£20,000 the following month; needs a close look from major yard which won this race in 2022 and 2023.

runners.name: Uptown Dandy
runners.comment: Placed twice in the mud at Exeter; different ground but he brings easily the best form
runners.spotlight: Second at Exeter (soft) in January on debut and and close third of 11 when favourite at the same track (heavy) in February; likely to face very different ground but brings easily the best form.

runners.name: Golden Whirl
runners.comment: Flat family; hood for debut; trainer has made his mark in bumpers, notably with newcomers
runners.spotlight: 4,000gns yearling; seventh foal; closely related to 6f-7f winner Crossing The Line (RPR 105), half-brother to four winners including Cicero's Gift (1m/8.7f; 114); dam 5f winner (108); sire is a classy stamina influence, though; hooded for debut; trainer has made his mark in bumpers, notably with newcomers.

runners.name: On To The Rouge
runners.breeder: Mrs J A Niven & Mr Michael Niven
runners.owner: Angus Racing Club & P D Niven
runners.comment: Trainer's bumper winners are less frequent nowadays but this newcomer needs a close look
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to bumper winner Ontherouge (debut winner for this yard in 2022); dam bumper winner, out of 2m4f hurdle winning half-sister to 1m6f Group 2 winner Clever Cookie; trainer's bumper winners are less frequent nowadays but this newcomer needs a close look.

runners.name: Chater Gold
runners.comment: Hinted at his ability this term; interesting contender making his dirt debut in this grade
runners.spotlight: Yet to strike in 14 career starts but has hinted at his ability this season; interesting contender on his first start on dirt in today's lower grade.

runners.name: Meepmeep
runners.comment: Posted a respectable effort on this surface last time; should go well in this lower grade
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start to his career but remains a maiden after 11 outings; posted a respectable effort on his dirt debut three weeks ago and should go well in this lower grade.

runners.name: Super Treasure
runners.owner: Martin Yung Ping Fai & Kwok Yi Chit
runners.comment: Well beaten in all five career starts; today's drop in grade is unlikely to be enough
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in all five career starts to date; today's drop in grade is unlikely to be enough to spark improvement.

runners.name: Yodas Choice
runners.owner: Alan Lee Yu Sing & Estate Of The Late Lee Kwok Kay
runners.comment: Has hit the crossbar several times this season; starting to become frustrating
runners.spotlight: Has hit the crossbar several times this season, including a solid second on this surface in January; clearly has ability but starting to become frustrating.

runners.name: Smart Beauty
runners.comment: Improved steadily last year but hasn't progressed this term; 3lb below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Improved steadily early last year but hasn't progressed this term; now 3lb below his last winning mark and needs to capitalise.

runners.name: Smart Zipang
runners.comment: Failed to feature in novice company last season and much of the same story in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Failed to feature in novice company last season and has been safely held since switching to handicaps; easy to oppose.

runners.name: Colourful Baron
runners.comment: Yet to build on a C&D success in October; needs to find more off his current mark
runners.spotlight: Landed his second local success with a C&D win in October but has failed to build on that effort in two outings since; needs to find more off his current mark.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Supporting Irish Champions Weekend (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Cornman is a lovely horse. He was always going to improve for a run and Colin says he will improve again. He was always going to be a three-year-old. He is one to look forward to - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer

runners.name: Tradition
runners.comment: Posted several creditable efforts this season; switch to dirt could provide a breakthrough
runners.spotlight: Winless in 16 local starts but has posted several creditable efforts this season; a switch to dirt could provide the breakthrough.

runners.name: Fire Ball
runners.breeder: G M & Mrs G M Hewson
runners.comment: 5-53; has winning form from higher marks, but age may be catching up
runners.spotlight: 8yo with five wins from 53 starts; scored over 1m on turf here in December and has winning form from higher marks, but age may be catching up.

runners.name: On The Lash
runners.comment: Posted a career-best on New Year's Day but has regressed since; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Posted a career-best effort when narrowly beaten over 1m1f here on New Year's Day but has regressed since; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Harrys Hero
runners.comment: Broke his local duck in December but hasn't backed that effort up; step forward needed
runners.spotlight: Broke his local duck with a 7f turf win in December but hasn't backed that effort up in two outings since; needs a big step forward to defy his current mark.

runners.name: Yeaboi
runners.owner: Ting Ping Sing, David Ting Chi Ho & Ting Mei Wan
runners.comment: Aside from one blip has been in good form this season; remains a threat off current mark
runners.spotlight: Aside from one blip, has been in good form this season, including a December win; remains a threat off his revised rating.

runners.name: Turtle Again
runners.breeder: Mrs H G & W G Bax & Goldeye Trust
runners.owner: Ho Koon Wah, Dominic Ho Tsz Kin Et Al
runners.comment: Returned to form in November but hasn't built on that effort; more needed
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with a fair third over 1m1f in November but hasn't built on that effort; more needed off his current mark.

runners.name: Joyful Champion
runners.owner: Raymond Chow Wai Kam & Lau Wing Sang
runners.comment: Decent form at the end of last year but recent efforts have been disappointing
runners.spotlight: Gained his first local win over C&D last season and was in decent form at the end of last year; recent efforts have been disappointing and he needs to rebound.

runners.name: Youremyeverything
runners.comment: Has performed fairly in six starts this season without suggesting a win is imminent
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run; has performed fairly in six starts this season without suggesting a win is imminent.

runners.name: Perfect Peach
runners.comment: Went close off a higher mark in September, but his form has tailed off; revival needed
runners.spotlight: Closed last season with a win and went close off a higher mark in September, but his form has tailed off since; revival needed.

runners.name: Glorious Expert
runners.comment: Inconsistent but has shown promise in nine career starts; looks capable in this grade
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent but has shown promise in nine career starts; capable of making an impact in this lower grade if on a going day.

runners.name: Romantic Novelist
runners.owner: Elvis Kwok Kam Chuen & Kwok Ping Kan

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Love Racing Et Al

runners.comment: Struggled in ten local starts; hard to recommend despite today's drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Has struggled in ten local starts, including when beaten out of sight over C&D on dirt debut; hard to recommend despite today's drop in grade.

runners.name: Modest Gentleman
runners.comment: Competitive in six starts this term and no surprise if he plays a major role here
runners.spotlight: Dual 5f winner at Happy Valley last season; has been competitive in six starts this term and no surprise if he plays a major role here.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Special Power has been the cause of his own downfall a few times but he got it right tonight. If he's alright we might go to Naas on Sunday for the Birdcatcher - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.name: The Prime
runners.comment: Yet to get seriously competitive; needs the switch to dirt to bring about improvement
runners.spotlight: Yet to get seriously competitive in eight career outings; needs the switch to dirt to bring about improvement.

runners.name: Yeah Buddy
runners.comment: Has improved since switching to this surface; still needs more to get off the mark today
runners.spotlight: Has improved since switching to this surface, posting a career best when fourth over C&D in January; still needs more to get off the mark today.

runners.name: The Khan
runners.comment: Turf winner in October and ran well when third three weeks ago; bit more needed today
runners.spotlight: 7f turf winner in October and ran well when third three weeks ago; needs to kick on again to overcome current mark, though.

runners.name: Falcon Court
runners.comment: Scored in good style over C&D on his penultimate outing but disappointed last time
runners.spotlight: Scored in good style over C&D on his penultimate outing but disappointed off his revised mark last time; bounce-back needed.

runners.name: Flying Phantom
runners.comment: Showed some promise in December but hasn't built on that effort; now switches to dirt
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 17 starts; showed some promise over 7f in December but hasn't built on that effort since and now switches to dirt.

runners.name: Patch Of Watch
runners.comment: Made amends for a near-miss last month; hard to ignore in current form
runners.spotlight: Made amends for a near-miss with a breakthrough C&D win last month; 6lb rise demands more but he is hard to ignore in current form.

runners.name: Super Joy
runners.comment: Hasn't made much of impact in five outings this term; now 2lb below winning mark
runners.spotlight: Finally broke his maiden tag over C&D last season but hasn't made much of impact in five outings this term; now 2lb below that winning mark.

runners.name: Cool Blue
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who hasn't shown enough to suggest a breakthrough is imminent
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who hasn't shown enough to suggest a breakthrough is imminent; others preferred.

runners.name: Wind Speeder

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: On a long losing run but has been consistent this season; another win may not be far away
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but has been consistent this season with only a few poor efforts in 13 starts; another win may not be far away.

runners.name: Speedy Smartie
runners.breeder: Mrs V A & W K Pike
runners.owner: Dr Andrew Yu, Dr Alvin Yu Man Ho & Dr Bernice Yu Man Yan
runners.comment: Posted several promising efforts this term; not ruled out if making the line-up
runners.spotlight: Posted several promising efforts this term, including a close third over 6f on turf 11 days ago; not ruled out if making the line-up.

runners.name: Sweet Diamond
runners.comment: Yet to fire this term but has dropped to a tempting mark; considered if getting a run
runners.spotlight: Scored back-to-back 6f wins at Happy Valley last season; yet to fire this term but has dropped to a tempting mark; considered if getting a run.

runners.name: Thesis
runners.comment: Has hit form of late with two good Happy Valley efforts; yet to make top three on dirt.
runners.spotlight: Suffered 12 straight defeats after arriving from Britain; broke duck at Happy Valley last month off 5lb lower mark, then solid 1.75l third; no better than fourth in four previous dirt runs.

quotes.race: Britannia Stakes (Heritage Handicap) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Thesis won off 90 today, he's heading towards 100 now. I think he's a good horse. He was the biggest horse in the field; he's got scope and size, so hopefully he can progress - Harry Charlton, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Shanghai Style
runners.breeder: R N Cunningham & Haunui Farm Lp
runners.comment: Shock C&D scorer last time; 5lb rise and wide draw make things tougher here.
runners.spotlight: Surprise 28-1 C&D neck winner for different apprentice rider this month; has been upped 5lb and wide draw makes prominent racing style hard to pull off.

runners.name: Von Baer
runners.comment: Six modest local runs to date; better last time (6f); new surface/longer trip could suit.
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner for Brian Meehan in Britain; best effort in six local tries when 3.25l fourth (6f, Happy Valley) two weeks ago; dropped another 2lb; could be transformed by longer trip/switch to dirt.

quotes.race: tote Are Online Too At tote.co.uk Racing League 16 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Von Baer just wandered around quite a lot. I was left in front a long way from home. I didn't really want to be as forward as I ended up being through the race and he was lonely from the three [furlong] pole onwards. I was just trying to keep his mind focussed in the right direction but he was always pulling out enough and he's obviously a pretty smart horse. I think he won despite the track - he did feel a bit unbalanced in the first half of the race - but the cut in the ground probably helped and he's still very lightly raced so there's plenty left to come - Saffie Osborne, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Roman Crown
runners.breeder: Lynn Lodge Stud & Pier House Stud
runners.comment: No better than third in nine local outings and may find this trip too far.
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f AW scorer in Britain; one solitary 6f third apart, his local form has been disappointing and a recent poor C&D run did not answer stamina questions marks.

runners.name: Chill Kaka
runners.comment: Has begun career with two good runs and two lesser efforts; chance if staying this trip.
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent but placed twice in four starts, both times over 6f on dirt here; has never gone beyond 7f but is a leading contender if he stays this far.

runners.name: The Way We Win
runners.comment: Little sign of any great ability on six runs so far; eyeshields applied.
runners.spotlight: Has run poorly at odds of at least 69-1 on all six starts to date; eyeshields now reached for, though that smacks of desperation.

runners.name: Lucky Banner
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Stephen Ho Wai Man, F Ho Ka Chun & D Ho Ka Chung
runners.comment: Has gone close over C&D four times off similar marks; lacks recent form and drawn wide.
runners.spotlight: Runner-up, beaten by less than 1l, over this C&D on four occasions, most recently in November; last two runs have been well below best but he's down to a good mark; poor draw.

runners.name: Run Run Timing
runners.breeder: G W Holdings A T F The Edwina Trust
runners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

runners.comment: Well below his best this season; now switched to dirt and going beyond 7f for first time.
runners.spotlight: Eight modest runs since twice placed off 13lb higher mark in June/July; unlikely this first go at both beyond 7f and racing on dirt will turn things around.

runners.name: Spangle Fortune
runners.comment: Has followed two fine C&D runs late last year with two much lesser efforts.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner off 8lb lower mark in November, then posted new career best when beaten by a nose; two subsequent starts have been underwhelming; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Lucky Impact
runners.comment: Needs longer trip to bring big improvement following five poor efforts this term.
runners.spotlight: Only beaten by 1l on career debut last July; all five subsequent runs have been moderate; returning from six weeks off and stepping up in trip.

runners.name: Phantom Cyclone
runners.breeder: Mrs J M & T M Henderson

prev_owners.owner: A Best, K Best Et Al

runners.comment: Never better than eighth in ten local tries; experiencing dirt for the first time here.
runners.spotlight: Won a 2yo race in New Zealand but has exhibited very limited ability in ten Hong Kong outings; switching to dirt off a career-low mark.

runners.name: Apolar Fighter
runners.comment: Disappointing latest but previously 1.75l fourth off 3lb higher mark; dirt debut.
runners.spotlight: Two fourths in his last four runs have been his best returns from 11 attempts; dropped another 2lb for his first dirt outing; cannot be ruled out in this modest affair.

runners.name: Perfect Pairing
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Jerry Chow Shiu Ming
runners.comment: Hard to fancy on the back of 11 modest efforts to date; tongue-tie applied.
runners.spotlight: Yet to finish within 3l of the winner in 11 career starts; continues to tumble down the ratings but needs application of a tongue-tie to bring big improvement.

runners.name: All Eyes On Me
runners.owner: Enrico Chow Yue Hin & Jennifer Ng Mau Yee
runners.comment: Blinkers (tried last twice) removed; needs this longer trip to work some magic.
runners.spotlight: Has been sent off at massive odds on each of his six career starts and run accordingly each time; up in trip here with blinkers removed.

runners.name: Owners Praise
runners.comment: Dual 7f winner making belated dirt debut; penultimate run was not too bad; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f scorer off slightly higher marks but not for 11 months and has never raced on dirt in 24 appearances.

runners.name: Gluck Racer
runners.comment: Two poor efforts since 7f win off 6lb lower mark; unproven on dirt/beyond 7f; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner but never over more than 7f; eighth of 12 on only previous dirt run (two years ago); has disappointed the last twice.

runners.name: Happy Tango
runners.comment: Modest recent form and drawn wide but cannot be discounted on return to Class 5.
runners.spotlight: Veteran with 6-73 winning record; placed only once in eight tries since 5f win off 6lb higher in October but will appreciate dropping back to Class 5 for the first time in almost a year.

runners.name: Hinokami Kagura
runners.comment: Still a maiden by has run some big races in defeat and is dropped in class here.
runners.spotlight: Yet to win in 15 attempts but has been runner-up off higher marks over this C&D on three occasions and merits consideration off career-low mark; first try in Class 5.

runners.name: Oriental Tycoon
runners.comment: Has shown little in 12 Hong Kong outings; now down to Class 5 with new headgear.
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in Australia but never in the top six in 12 local starts; needs combination of drop to Class 5 and switch to blinkers (from a visor) to have a big positive effect.

runners.name: Sky Prophet
runners.owner: Kwan Shiu Man,Jessica Kwan Mun Hang & Jeffrey Kwan Chun Ming
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden; only placing was over C&D; may be revitalised following a brief layoff.
runners.spotlight: Has had excuses (1m too far then unsuited by slow ground) since career-best third over this C&D of 4lb higher mark in January; returning from six weeks away; won a recent trial race.

runners.name: Speedy Fortune
runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co
runners.comment: Disappointed when strongly fancied last time and is poorly drawn for a front-runner.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who looked to have everything in his favour when only ninth of 14 last time following good 5f third; stays this trip but wide draw tempers enthusiasm.

runners.name: Flying Romantic
runners.comment: Almost sprang a 23-1 surprise in first-time blinkers eight weeks ago; unproven on dirt.
runners.spotlight: Responded positively to the application of blinkers/return from a break when neck runner-up last time; off for another eight weeks since; blinkers may not work so well again and he's unproven on dirt.

runners.name: Sonic Boom
runners.owner: George Lee Hing Fai, Wong Che Leung Et Al
runners.comment: Struggles to win (1-20 strike rate) but is a consistent sort back down to a fair mark.
runners.spotlight: Now 1lb lower than for his solitary career success (over this C&D in July) and has finished in the top four in each of his last four C&D attempts; has solid each-way prospects.

runners.name: Day Day Victory
runners.owner: Alan Kiang Ping Fai & Joyce Lee
runners.comment: Failed to build on fair 2l third over 5f two months ago; this surface is a question mark.
runners.spotlight: Achieved his first placing when third (5f, Happy Valley) in January but two poor runs since (finished lame once) and has performed moderately in three previous dirt outings.

runners.name: Flying Dragon
runners.comment: Very well handicapped if back to near his best but is badly out of form.
runners.spotlight: Triple C&D scorer in his prime but placed just once in his last 15 appearances, and current losing run now stretches for over two years.

runners.name: Cheer For South
runners.owner: Chan Man Chun, James Mathew Fong Et Al
runners.comment: A 22-race maiden but is knocking at the door and may be freshened up by six weeks off.
runners.spotlight: A dangerous betting proposition given that he has been beaten in all 22 races but he has finished runner-up over this C&D on two his last three starts; back from a six-week break.

runners.name: Diamond Soars
runners.comment: On a long losing run; his four wins have been off higher marks and he's back running well.
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner but not for over 17 months; back to form of late and could go well again here off 2lb higher than when touched off by a head over 5f last time.

runners.name: California Icon
runners.comment: Big 7f career best at massive odds last time; needs to back that up over shorter/on dirt.
runners.spotlight: Finally managed his first placing at the 16th attempt when third over 7f as a 53-1 outsider 17 days ago; that was probably a weak race; now down in trip/switching surface.

runners.name: Brilliant Fire
runners.comment: Hard to fancy after six moderate efforts to date; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Looks set to struggle again having failed to get within 5l of the winner in six career starts.

runners.name: Ivictoriam
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Henry H L Chan & Mr & Mrs Michael T H Lee
runners.comment: Good second two starts ago but that was over 1m on turf; untried on dirt; reserve.
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; disappointed last time and previous career-best 1.5l second was over 1m on turf; first dirt outing.

runners.name: Everstar
runners.owner: Jackie F C Hang, Colin L P Cheung & Fredrick F C Lun
runners.comment: Ex-Australian 4yo who has not shown a great deal in three 6f turf races in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who has not shown a great deal in three 6f turf races in Hong Kong; drops in grade for today's dirt debut but still needs to up his game.

runners.name: Solid Shalaa
runners.comment: In very good form over C&D when last seen but has fitness to prove after 340-day layoff
runners.spotlight: Stayed on strongly to open Hong Kong account over C&D a year ago and made the frame over C&D on both subsequent appearances but has fitness to prove after 340-day absence.

runners.name: Natural High
runners.comment: Emphatic C&D winner this month; 9lb higher and drawn wide today, though
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has been aided by blinkers in recent months and kept on strongly for an emphatic C&D win this month; evidently in prime form but combination of 9lb rise and wide draw makes things tougher today.

runners.name: Patch Of Time
runners.comment: In career-best form on turf this month and has good draw for dirt debut
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner here in early part of the season and probably posted a career-best performance when very close second on that surface this month; won a C&D trial last year and is well drawn for this official dirt debut; likely contender.

runners.name: Everyones Gallop
runners.comment: Flopped badly on last month's debut but had impressed in a C&D trial beforehand
runners.spotlight: Flopped badly when among the market leaders for last month's debut (6f, turf) but had impressed in a C&D dirt trial a few days earlier and remains a very interesting prospect; swaps blinkers for first-time visor on this official dirt debut.

runners.name: Regency Win Win
runners.comment: Makes official debut after some underwhelming trials and is probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Out of a very smart 7.5f-2m winner in New Zealand but makes his official debut after some underwhelming trials and is probably best watched.

runners.name: Sunny Darling

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Mrs B C Bateman Et Al

runners.comment: C&D winner in early part of this season but needs to better his recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D in the early part of this season and is back on a workable mark now but needs to get back in the groove after some below-par recent efforts.

runners.name: Looks Outstanding
runners.owner: Dennis Chow Chi In, Choi Yuk Ping & Edward Tsui Wing Tak
runners.comment: Made quite promising debut over C&D but his second run was a shade disappointing
runners.spotlight: Made quite promising debut when fifth over C&D from stall 12 last month but his second run was a shade disappointing and blinkers are now added; others appeal more.

runners.name: Noble Go
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Tony Tang Wai Bun, Vicky Tang & Vivian Tang
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on all three turf starts; makes dirt debut today
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on all three turf starts; significant improvement is required on this dirt debut.

runners.name: Solar River
runners.comment: 0-6 on turf but went close here in January; a possible if this surface switch suits
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on turf but went close here in January and his recent Happy Valley sixth was also a good effort; could have a say if suited by today's switch to dirt.

runners.name: California Star
runners.breeder: Mme Julie Mestrallet, Mme Francine Mestrallet Mercier & Mme

prev_owners.owner: The Exors Of The Estate Of The Late Howard Liang Yum Shing

runners.comment: Well beaten over 1m here this month and has now been unplaced all five starts
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when upped to 1m this month and has now been unplaced all five starts; combination of drop back in trip and favourable draw not enough to tempt.

runners.name: Silver Spurs
runners.comment: Gave good account on turf this month but wide draw a big negative today
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; gave good account when fourth on turf at Happy Valley this month and seemed to take fairly well to dirt two starts ago but his wide draw is a big negative today.

runners.name: Jolly Companion
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner during very mixed campaign this season; hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner during very mixed campaign this season but his recent efforts have been disappointing and it's hard to predict whether he'll be in the right mood today.

runners.name: Excellent Daddy
runners.comment: Dual Class 5 C&D winner this season but twice safely held since returned to this grade
runners.spotlight: Exploited some considerable help from the handicapper when winning consecutive Class 5 C&D races in December/January but was safely held on both starts since returning to this higher grade.

runners.name: Stormi
runners.comment: Has made a low-key start to his Hong Kong career but will appreciate this ease in grade
runners.spotlight: Three-time 1m AW winner in Ireland; yet to be placed after five Hong Kong starts but was denied a clear run when eighth over C&D this month and will appreciate today's ease in grade; worth a second look.

quotes.race: Patton Race
quotes.quote: Bergamasco is a big, honest horse that loves a gallop. He has thrived up here, obviously gets a mile well and likes the surface. I think he is a good advertisement for what we do with a relatively small team of horses - Jack Davison, trainer

runners.name: I P O Bros
runners.comment: Smart when based in Singapore but a never-dangerous outsider on first five HK starts
runners.spotlight: Smart when based in Singapore but a never-dangerous outsider on first five Hong Kong starts (6f-7f, all turf); drops in grade and moves up in trip for this dirt debut.

runners.name: Precision Goal
runners.comment: Bang-in-form 6yo who has won three of his last five over C&D; player, despite tough mark
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form 6yo who has won three of his last five over C&D; seemingly on a tough mark now but there's a very good chance he'll give another good account.

runners.name: Charming Steed
runners.comment: Slightly disappointing on turf last month but his dirt win in January was convincing
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing when back on turf last month but looked as good as ever when scoring over 1m1f on dirt two starts ago and won't be far away if in similar form again today.

runners.name: Forever Folks
runners.comment: Not very reliable but this C&D suits and his current mark is workable
runners.spotlight: Not one to rely upon heavily but ran well in defeat behind Charming Steed here (1m1f) on latest outing six weeks ago and is still only 2lb higher than for C&D win in October.

runners.name: Viva Chaleur

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Close third over C&D this month but this regressive 6yo is now 0-24 in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well for a close third over C&D this month and has obvious each-way claims if judged on that performance but this regressive 6yo is now 0-24 in Hong Kong.

runners.name: All Are Mine
runners.comment: Out of sorts since returning from one-year absence in December; revival needed
runners.spotlight: Scored by a neck off today's mark on dirt in December 2023 but has looked out of sorts since returning from a one-year absence; revival needed.

runners.name: Escape Route
runners.comment: Left it late in the day to launch dirt career but recent C&D runs were very respectable
runners.spotlight: 7yo who left if very late in the day to launch his dirt career but has posted a couple of very respectable efforts over C&D in recent weeks; probably won't be far away.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Escape Route has shown a nice attitude. He was a little bit green early on, but he was drawn on the outside and needed time to find his feet. He's a bit backward but he's been going well at home and should improve a lot from that - Danny Tudhope, rider.

runners.name: Qingyuan Star
runners.owner: Cheung Kwok Ping & Cheung Kwok Keung
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who made quite promising stable debut on turf last month; dirt debut today
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who made an encouraging stable debut when sixth on turf here (7f; first-time blinkers) last month; moves up in trip for this dirt debut; interesting to see whether he can build upon that recent effort.

runners.name: Fashion Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: 0-17 in HK; on tempting mark for dirt debut but yet to convince stamina-wise over 1m
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 5yo with 0-17 strike-rate in Hong Kong; makes dirt debut from a tempting mark but is yet to convince stamina-wise over 1m and is not the percentage call.

runners.name: Confringo
runners.comment: Narrow Class 5 turf winner last month; well held in this grade since; dirt debut today
runners.spotlight: Came good with narrow 1m turf win in Class 5 here last month, his eighth start, but found things much tougher when back up in this grade a fortnight ago and needs to kick on again on this dirt debut.

runners.name: Silver King
runners.comment: Well beaten over C&D on recent dirt debut and very difficult to enthuse over at the moment
runners.spotlight: Out of form this season, most recently when a down-the-field outsider over C&D on this month's dirt debut; very difficult to enthuse over at the moment.

runners.name: Flying Silver
runners.comment: Back down to his last winning mark and probably worth another go on dirt; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Seemingly a shade too high in the weights since turf success last April but is now back down to his winning mark; not seen on dirt since respectable debut on this surface in 2022 but, with 10lb claimer Britney Wong enlisted, he's one to consider.

runners.name: Lucky Gold
runners.comment: Not firing on all cylinders this season and this 41st HK start will be his dirt debut
runners.spotlight: Not firing on all cylinders this season and this 41st Hong Kong start will be his dirt debut; swaps usual blinkers for first-time visor.

runners.name: Bright Inheritance
runners.owner: 23/24 Dennis C H Yip Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Darby Racing, A R Burfoot Et Al
Darby Racing, G Bachell Et Al

runners.comment: Didn't run badly on turf 11 days ago but has not been at his best this season
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly on turf 11 days ago but has not been at his best this season; will be making his dirt debut if he gets a run.

runners.name: Beautiful Win
runners.owner: Sandia Yit Lau Ying Lam & Yit Kwok Leung
runners.comment: Placed on turf two starts ago but latest run was a backward step; dirt debut
runners.spotlight: 0-8 on turf; suggested his turn might be near when placed over 7f in February but did not build on that performance over 1m last time; this will be his dirt debut.

runners.name: Monta Frutta
runners.comment: Yet to strike form this season but sure to appreciate this ease in grade
runners.spotlight: Yet to strike form after four runs this season but is suited by this C&D and is sure to appreciate today's drop in grade; can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Fortune Warrior
runners.comment: Placed off today's mark since last month's comfortable C&D win; likely contender again
runners.spotlight: Back in prime form in recent weeks, winning comfortably over C&D before a good third off today's mark; has better draw than last time and ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Rising Force
runners.owner: Tai Woon Shing & Chan Koon Man
runners.comment: Won a recent dirt trial cosily and is well drawn for this official debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Out of a three-time 7f/1m winner; won a recent 6f dirt trial cosily and is well drawn for this official debut; interesting to see how he fares.

runners.name: Arden
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs James Tien Pei Chun
runners.comment: A down-the-field outsider on both his turf starts and has the outside draw for dirt debut
runners.spotlight: A down-the-field outsider on both his turf starts and has the outside draw for this dirt debut.

runners.name: Patch Of Stars
runners.comment: Displayed clear promise on all four turf starts; makes dirt debut today
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who has displayed clear promise on all four turf starts (6f-7f); can make his present felt on this dirt debut.

runners.name: Vulcanus
runners.comment: In good form since emphatic Class 5 C&D win in December but has tough draw today
runners.spotlight: In good form in this higher grade since emphatic Class 5 C&D win in December; holds no secrets from the handicapper, though, and has a tough draw.

runners.name: Daily Trophy
runners.owner: Peter Cheng & Jerry Cheng Chun Ho
runners.comment: Career-best form when winning over C&D last month; 7lb higher and drawn wide today
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner this season, latterly when posting a career-best performance six weeks ago; evidently in very good nick but combination of wide draw and latest 7lb rise makes this a tough task.

runners.name: Colourful Winner
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden who seems to have gone off the boil lately; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; suggested his turn was near when making the frame on consecutive 6f turf starts in October/November but seems to have gone off the boil lately.

runners.name: Taihang Scenery
runners.comment: Placed at end of last season but well below that form on all three starts this term
runners.spotlight: Placed on turf at end of last season, his third start, but has not come close to matching that form on his three appearances this term; needs to up his game on this dirt debut.

runners.name: Jolly Jumper
runners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: 0-6 on turf but recent efforts have been encouraging; a possible on this dirt debut
runners.spotlight: A maiden after six starts but his recent 6f/7f turf runs have been very encouraging and he continues to edge down the weights; could have a say on this dirt debut.

runners.name: Fun N Glory
runners.comment: Ran big race from the front on turf this month and is very well drawn to attack today
runners.spotlight: Well beaten over C&D last month but ran big race from the front under Britney Wong when third on turf here 17 days ago and is very well drawn to attack today.

runners.name: Gimme Five
runners.breeder: Mrs A S & P D Johnson
runners.comment: Second over C&D last month but below form on turf since and now 0-16
runners.spotlight: Chased home Daily Trophy off today's mark over C&D last month and is a contender if judged on that performance but was below form on turf three weeks ago and is now 0-16.

runners.name: Robot Knight
runners.comment: Largely consistent over C&D since his win off 4lb lower in October; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent over C&D since his win off 4lb lower in October and will have each-way claims at least if he gets a run today.

runners.name: Decrelot
runners.owner: Hk Football Club Horse Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after five turf runs; dirt debut today
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after five turf runs; needs this change of surface to enable huge improvement.

runners.name: Telecom Fighters
runners.comment: Regressive front-runner with a very mixed record this season; drawn wide; others are safer
runners.spotlight: Regressive front-runner with very mixed record this season; suited by this C&D and on a good mark but wide draw makes things awkward today and he can't be supported with much confidence.

runners.name: Flamingo Trillion
runners.comment: His turf form dipped last time and this switch to dirt may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Won three times on turf (1m1f) towards end of last season and has posted some good efforts in defeat this term but his form dipped last time and this switch to dirt may not be ideal.

runners.name: Bundle Of Charm
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: Versatile 6yo who was placed over 6f on turf a week ago; can go well again today
runners.spotlight: Versatile 6yo who has performed well at up to 1m on turf and dirt this season; placed over 6f on turf a week ago and remains on a good mark; enters calculations, despite wide draw.

runners.name: Yellowfin
runners.owner: Raymond Ng Wing Chiu, Choi Chi Wan & Soong Tze Man
runners.comment: Ran quite well from the front over C&D this month and a recent 2lb drop helps
runners.spotlight: Not particularly consistent this season but gave it a pretty good shot from the front when sixth behind Ariel over C&D this month and is now 2lb lower than when second on turf here in January.

runners.name: Turin Mascot
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.owner: Dr Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung, Ken Huang Jian Hua & Tsoi Huk Yam

prev_owners.owner: Tsoi Huk Yam, Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung & Ken Huang Jian Hua

runners.comment: Looked in very good nick over C&D in October but his form has cooled since
runners.spotlight: Looked as good as ever when winning readily over C&D in October but his form has cooled since and he remains on a fairly tough mark.

quotes.race: Lengthen The Odds With BetVictor Race
quotes.quote: In Ecstasy is a progressive horse who enjoys the all-weather. We will have a look at heading back there in February for the Listed three-year-old race - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Romantic Laos
runners.comment: Five-time turf winner; makes rather belated dirt debut today; others look better treated
runners.spotlight: 5-35 on turf, the latest win gained off 6lb lower at Happy Valley (1m) in December; makes a rather belated dirt debut today, though, and others look better handicapped.

runners.name: Perfect Team
runners.breeder: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum
runners.owner: Ringo Ng Yiu Kwok & Lisa Ng Chan Choi Wan

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh M B K Al Maktoum, R E Wilson & Ciaron Maher Racing

runners.comment: Creditable second over C&D this month and capable 7lb claimer Ellis Wong is enlisted today
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D in January and probably bettered that performance when second to Ariel over C&D this month; not ideally drawn today but capable 7lb claimer Ellis Wong is booked; shortlisted.

runners.name: Allcash
runners.comment: Smart when trained in Brazil but yet to make a splash after six Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Smart when trained in Brazil but yet to make a splash after six Hong Kong starts and may need more help from the local handicapper.

runners.name: Young Brilliant
runners.comment: Surprise C&D winner in December but quickly back in the doldrums since
runners.spotlight: Returned to form and made all to cause 44-1 surprise over C&D in December but is not one to rely upon heavily and was well beaten here on latest outing six weeks ago; can be opposed from stall 14.

quotes.race: Cazoo Handicap
quotes.quote: Swilcan Bridge handled the course well. He had a run here earlier in the year and had run very well at Goodwood last time out. He crept into the Royal Hunt Cup, actually, today, but when you've got the opportunity to run for this sort of prize-money, if he's going to take a 10lb hike it doesn't matter. You're just thrilled to have a winner on Derby Day - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Fighting Machine
runners.breeder: Miss J M, K J & Mrs M L Shaw
runners.comment: Disappointed on turf recently but placed five times over C&D since October
runners.spotlight: Needs to rebound quickly from a disappointing turf run 11 days ago but has been placed five times over C&D since October and will have very obvious each-way claims if back on song.

runners.name: Never Peter Out
runners.comment: Rapidly progressive 4yo who has collected four C&D wins since October; respected
runners.spotlight: Rapidly progressive 4yo who has collected four C&D wins since October and posted another good effort when fourth over C&D this month; may yet have more improvement to come; respected.

runners.name: Ariel
runners.comment: Kept on well to win from the front over C&D this month; 6lb rise might be tough to swallow
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to win readily from the front over C&D this month, his second dirt win of the season, but recent 6lb rise might be tough for this 7yo to swallow.

runners.name: New Forest
runners.comment: Slightly disappointing on turf last time but began HK career with two good runs (one C&D)
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who made the frame on first two Hong Kong starts, latterly when placed behind Never Peter Out over C&D last month; slightly disappointing when back on turf five weeks ago and is 2lb wrong today but remains of interest.

runners.name: Lucky Touch
runners.comment: Admirably consistent since turf win in November but up in grade and 5lb wrong today
runners.spotlight: In the frame six consecutive times since turf win at Happy Valley in November, the last three times over this C&D, but moves up in grade and competes from 5lb out of the weights today.

runners.name: Ivy League

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Placed twice on turf in recent months but this 33rd Hong Kong start will be his dirt debut
runners.spotlight: Placed twice on turf in recent months and remains on a workable mark but this 33rd Hong Kong start will be his first run on dirt.

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Blackwater Handicap
quotes.quote: Ivy League did that nicely. He's a big strong colt and he's very babyish still, he will progress and is probably not too bad. I don't think he'll have any problem stepping into stakes company. He is not short of pace. He would love horses in front of him and a race like the Jersey Stakes could be a good option for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Sing Dragon
runners.owner: The Rotary Club Of Gd-Hk-Ma-Gba Syndicate
runners.comment: Has 4-6 strike-rate over C&D and Britney Wong claims a hefty 10lb today
runners.spotlight: Has very good 4-6 strike-rate on dirt and looked as good as ever when placed over C&D six weeks ago; drawn wide today but Britney Wong claims a hefty 10lb; features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Glory Elite
runners.comment: Progressive on turf this season but has the outside stall on dirt debut
runners.spotlight: Progressive on turf this season and was beaten under 1l after attempting to make all here this month; needs to prove himself on dirt and overcome the outside stall today, though.

runners.name: Self Improvement
runners.owner: Wong Chung Yin & Wong Lai Ngor
runners.comment: Rallied gamely for narrow C&D win this month but recent 5lb rise demands even more
runners.spotlight: In-form 5yo who rallied gamely for narrow C&D win 17 days ago, his second dirt success this season; recent 5lb rise demands even more from him today, though.

runners.name: Call Me Glorious
runners.comment: Only fifth on turf this month but was placed over C&D off 7lb higher in December
runners.spotlight: Just a respectable fifth when tried in blinkers on turf this month but now 7lb lower than when placed over C&D in December; sports first-time eyeshields today; not drawn well but can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Gummy Gummy
runners.owner: Alan Kiang Ping Fai & Joyce Lee

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Went very close over C&D this month; well drawn again and remains on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Looked suited by the drop back to 6f when very close second to Self Improvement over C&D this month and is well drawn again today; still very well handicapped on some of last year's form; likely contender.

runners.name: Mask Rider
runners.comment: Emphatic C&D winner on HK debut in January and a close third over C&D this month
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who recorded an emphatic C&D success on his Hong Kong debut in January and bounced back from a lesser effort when close third over C&D this month; may still have potential; must be considered.

runners.name: Sports Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: Very consistent on turf; this return to dirt may not be ideal but he has the inside draw
runners.spotlight: Fast-starting prominent racer with a very consistent record on turf; may not be ideally suited by today's return to dirt but can't grumble about his draw.

runners.name: Must Go
runners.comment: Driven out for narrow C&D win two starts ago but others in this field look better treated
runners.spotlight: Consistent 4yo who was suited by the drop back in trip when driven out for narrow C&D win last month; posted another good effort when fifth here 17 days but may find others better handicapped again.

runners.name: Galaxy Witness
runners.comment: Both recent C&D runs were perfectly respectable but others appeal more all the same
runners.spotlight: Better known as a 7f/1m turf performer; both recent C&D runs were perfectly respectable but others appeal more all the same.

runners.name: Dragon Air Force
runners.owner: Au Kai Kwong & Michelle Jessica Au
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner this season and went very close when upped to this grade for latest run
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in Class 4 this season and lost out only by a head to Must Go when upped to this grade six weeks ago; might still be on the upgrade but is effectively 4lb higher from just out of the weights today.

runners.name: G Liner
runners.comment: Triple Class 4 dirt winner in first half of 2024; well held in this grade in July
runners.spotlight: Won three times on dirt (1m-1m1f) in early part of last year but found things tougher when upped to this grade in July and we haven't seen him again since; 4lb wrong today; looks up against it.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice maiden and I think he can get off the mark sooner rather than later. 19-04-21

runners.name: Candlelight Dinner
runners.comment: Made the frame at big odds on turf (5f) in January but well beaten twice since
runners.spotlight: Outran 53-1 odds when fourth over 5f on turf in January, his fourth Hong Kong start, but well down the field over that trip twice since; back up to 6f for dirt debut; too risky.

runners.name: Victory Moments
runners.comment: Generally in poor form this season; difficult to enthuse over
runners.spotlight: Hinted at possible return to form when sixth over C&D in December but two down-the-field runs followed and he now has it all to prove again.

runners.name: Genius Baby
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Pang Wai Hak, Frankie Pang Ka Yeung & A Pang Ka Wai
runners.comment: Won on debut in Australia last June but has fitness to prove on this Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Made winning debut in Australia (5.5f, AW) last June and looks an interesting recruit to the Hong Kong scene but has fitness to prove after 291-day absence.
